properties.Name: MasterBudget
properties.Description:
The MASTER BUDGET consists of a Product/Service Sales Budget and a General Budget, which are consolidated to produce the Master Budget.

The Master (static) budget is prepared for a single level of product volume based on best estimate of the level of production and sales for the coming period.

The master budget is a summary of company's plans that sets specific targets for sales, production, distribution and financing activities. 

It generally culminates in a cash budget, a budgeted income statement, and a budgeted balance sheet.  This budget represents a comprehensive expression of management's plans for future and how these plans are to be accomplished.

It usually consists of a number of separate but interdependent budgets. One budget may be necessary before the other can be initiated.  

Each budget estimate effects other budget estimates because the figures of one budget is usually used in the preparation of other budget. This is the reason why these budgets are called 'interdependent' budgets.

The Sales Budget(s) are prepared first based on best planned units and services to be produced or delivered for a specific product or service.

The General Budget supports all similar costs for non-product/service specific costs - that cannot be directly attributed to a specific product or service.

Actual numbers can be added at the end of the period to compare planned vs. actual.

A compliance ratio can be prepared that compares the planned to actual as a ratio that can be analyzed over time.

Columns.Name: MasterBudgetId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Master Budget.

Columns.Name: MasterBudgetVersionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Master Budget Version.

Columns.Name: BudgetPlanningCycleTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Budget Planning Cycle Type.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date for which the associated budget is prepared.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date for which the associated budget is prepared.

Columns.Name: PartyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Party.

Columns.Name: OrganizationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an organization.

Columns.Name: GeneralBudgetNumberOfDirectLaborEmployeesRequired
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned number of direct employees.

Columns.Name: GeneralBudgetDirectLaborEmployeeFullyBurdenedLaborCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned fully-burden direct labor employee costs for the period.

Columns.Name: GeneralBudgetNumberOfDirectLaborNonEmployeesRequired
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned number of direct non-employees forecast for the period.

Columns.Name: GeneralBudgetDirectLaborNonEmployeeFullyBurdenedLaborCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned fully-burden direct labor non-employee costs for the period.

Columns.Name: GeneralBudgetTotalOverheadCostAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned overhead costs for the associated period.

Columns.Name: GeneralBudgetTotalOverheadCostsCompliance
Columns.Description: (Budgeted Total Overhead Costs / Actual Total Overhead Costs) * 100

Columns.Name: GeneralBudgetMaterialsCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned Materials costs for the associated period general budget.

Columns.Name: GeneralBudgetSalesAndAdministrationExpensesCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned Sales and Administrative costs for the associated period.

Columns.Name: PlannedProductSalesRevenueAmount
Columns.Description:
The planned revenue to be derived from product-related unit sales for the associated budget period.

Ex:
Number of Municipal Bond Sales = $1,500M

Columns.Name: PlannedServiceDeliveryRevenueAmount
Columns.Description:
The planned revenue to be derived from service-related unit sales for the associated budget period.

Ex:
Number Of Wire Transfer Transactions = n services deliveries = $200,500 in service fees

Columns.Name: SalesBudgetNumberOfDirectLaborEmployeesRequired
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned number of direct employees.

Columns.Name: SalesBudgetDirectLaborEmployeeFullyBurdenedLaborCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned fully-burden direct labor employee costs for the period.

Columns.Name: SalesBudgetNumberOfDirectLaborNonEmployeesRequired
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned number of direct non-employees forecast for the period.

Columns.Name: SalesBudgetDirectLaborNonEmployeeFullyBurdenedLaborCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned fully-burden direct labor non-employee costs for the period.

Columns.Name: SalesBudgetTotalOverheadCostAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned overhead costs for the associated period.

Columns.Name: SalesBudgetTotalOverheadCostsCompliance
Columns.Description: (Budgeted Total Overhead Costs / Actual Total Overhead Costs) * 100

Columns.Name: SalesBudgetMaterialsCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned Materials costs for the associated period general budget.

Columns.Name: SalesBudgetSalesAndAdministrationExpensesCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The budgeted/planned Sales and Administrative costs for the associated period.

Columns.Name: IsoCurrencyCode
Columns.Description: The ISO 4217 currency code.

Properties.Description:
The MASTER BUDGET consists of a Product/Service Sales Budget and a General Budget, which are consolidated to produce the Master Budget.

The Master (static) budget is prepared for a single level of product volume based on best estimate of the level of production and sales for the coming period.

The master budget is a summary of company's plans that sets specific targets for sales, production, distribution and financing activities. 

It generally culminates in a cash budget, a budgeted income statement, and a budgeted balance sheet.  This budget represents a comprehensive expression of management's plans for future and how these plans are to be accomplished.

It usually consists of a number of separate but interdependent budgets. One budget may be necessary before the other can be initiated.  

Each budget estimate effects other budget estimates because the figures of one budget is usually used in the preparation of other budget. This is the reason why these budgets are called 'interdependent' budgets.

The Sales Budget(s) are prepared first based on best planned units and services to be produced or delivered for a specific product or service.

The General Budget supports all similar costs for non-product/service specific costs - that cannot be directly attributed to a specific product or service.

Actual numbers can be added at the end of the period to compare planned vs. actual.

A compliance ratio can be prepared that compares the planned to actual as a ratio that can be analyzed over time.
